Problem 1.2

Rubber Band Stretcher Experiment: Drawing Similar (Scale) Figures

In Problem 1.1, Daphne used ratio relationships to solve the mystery. She reasoned:

For every inch measured on the PI Monthly magazine, there are 10 inches of the PI Monthly magazine in real life.

I used the PI Monthly magazine height to measure the height of the teacher.

The teacher is 7 PI Monthly magazines tall. So, in real life the teacher is 7 x 10 inches or 70 inches tall.

Daphneâ€™s reasoning is similar to the reasoning we have done in the Comparing Quantities unit where we used ratios to describe and compare quantities. Recall that a ratio is a comparison of two quantities which have a multiplicative relationship, such as two lengths.

  • 1 P.I. Monthly magazine height for every picture height of the teacher (7 P.I. Monthly magazines) or
  • 1 P.I. Monthly magazine height to the picture height of the teacher (7 P.I. Monthly magazines) or
  • 1 P.I. Monthly magazine : 7 P.I. Monthly magazines
  • 10 inches : 70 inches

Using ratio relationships to solve problems is also called proportional reasoning. The picture of the real-life teacher is an image of the teacher. The original figure and its image are similar figures or scale drawings. In this problem, we will compare features of the original figure and its image.

What stays the same? What changes?
